metadata.synopsis: This dialog plays after picking up the Crown Controller ring off Ketheric’s body. The player will realize that they need to collect the other two Crown Controllers from Orin and Gortash before they can use them to command the Elder Brain. Picking up the Crown Controller allows the party to continue onward to the epilogue/intermezzo of Act 2.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play first and set up some important stuff.In order for this dialog to trigger, Ketheric must be defeated and the Crown Controller ring must be picked up from his body.Debug command: "oe KethericShowdown_Start" then "oe KethericShowdown_Defeat" then loot the Crown Controller ring off Ketheric's body.

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *In death, the body is cooling, but energy radiates from the stone.*
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches next to Ketheric's body. Shot of the netherstone embedded in the armour. Player wrestles the stone out of the armour and lifts it into view.

47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up stone. A portal opens up behind it (same one we used in Astral Prison to travel back to material plane.) Daisy steps out (in cine only.)

13.text: And now the picture comes together.

23.text: The Absolute is neither god nor man. It is the elder brain you saw, held here by those three against its will.

2.text: The crown it wears controls it, and these stones control the crown. It has been dominated.

54.text: To master an elder brain... to subdue it... Our enemies are formidable.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: How is it you're able to leave the Astral Prism now?

15.text: A temporary reprieve, but a welcome one. With the brain on its way to the city, its influence here is weakened.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: What can you tell me about the Crown the brain was wearing?

4.text: The crown's markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

14.text: It is a crown of domination. The stones were taken from its crest. They are Netherstones, imbued with the ability to control the wearer of the crown.

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: Whoever controls the crown could reshape the world... if they can control it.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: Netherese power like nothing anyone's seen in ages. They say magic led to the destruction of Netheril itself...

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Netherese? These Chosen are powerful indeed to have such magic in their command.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I came here looking for a cure - I still haven't found one.

16.text: Perhaps not a cure, but you've found the source of your infection. And the reason for its abnormality.

8.text: The crown atop the elder brain. Its markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

17.text: The crown's Netherese magic must be the true source of the parasites' abilities. This must be what elevates their potential.

65.text: If the crown can do this to the parasites, I dare not imagine what it is doing to the brain.

51.text: And it must be the reason nobody could heal you.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Do you know who our enemies are?

40.text: One of them I know. Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. A worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I know one of them. Enver Gortash.

3.text: I'm familiar. An arms dealer and a slaver. Worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny. It sounds as though you've faced his tyranny yourself.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

41.text: The other is a mystery to me. But the way she spoke, it is most likely she follows Bhaal - god of murder.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orin. Close-up of signs of Bhaal on Orin.NodeContext: walk few steps forwads while looking at Orin who stand infront of you, please get video from Greg for character positions as ref. [Choices]

36.text: Ketheric was a follower of Myrkul. Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are the Chosen of the Dead Three.
36.context: NodeContext: putting together the pieces as they speak

9.text: Since Ketheric is the Chosen of Myrkul, that means... the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.
9.context: NodeContext: putting the pieces together as they speak

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Ketheric transformed during the fight - what was that?

38.text: I believe you fought and defeated an avatar of Myrkul, the god of necromancy. A remarkable feat.

5.text: I know Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. He is a worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

39.text: Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.

31.text: Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul. The tyrant, the assassin, and the necromancer.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: If possible, show the mural of the Dead Three from END_GodsAndMonsters_WithersMeeting.

62.text: They are known to pick from their most devout followers a Chosen, granting them incredible powers.

52.text: Each one alone would be a formidable enemy.
52.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

20.text: But working together, and controlling an elder brain...
20.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

10.text: But working together, and with those stones and that crown...
10.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

21.text: I dare not imagine what they might achieve.
21.context: NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

50.text: We prepare for the fight of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.

34.text: The army of the Absolute is marching on Baldur's Gate.

19.text: Within the city, an elder brain brimming with power, ready to turn everyone within its reach into mind flayers. All it needs is an order.

56.text: An order the death gods' Chosen are on the cusp of giving.

30.text: We must wrest control of the brain from the Chosen before that happens - we must take their stones.

68.text: Our chances of success are slim, but we must not fail. If we fail, everything ends.

27.text: I will be your shield, but you must be the sword.

37.text: And when the chance comes to strike, you must take it. For there may only be one chance.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: What hope do we have if the gods themselves are involved?

32.text: Hope is a luxury for those who have a choice.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want my parasite removed.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want to get rid of the mind flayer parasites.

64.text: I know. But this is the only way.

44.text: I know. But the path to one lies through the other.

29.text: Are you so blind to what's at stake?

67.text: This is the battle of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.

24.text: So it is accomplished. The first step.
